sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Over 2,300 people confirmed dead following flash floods in Libya, with many more people still missing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Remote villagers appeal for help after Morocco's earthquake destroyed homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than 2,800 people died, with the toll expected to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Over 2,300 people are now confirmed to have died as a result of flooding in Libya.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Officials say 7,000 have been injured and thousands more are missing following torrential rains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The worst affected area is the city of Dirna, where two dams burst.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Red Crescent said its workers are struggling to cope with the scale of the disaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_21
sentences.sentence: The challenges are ranging between access to basic health facilities or health services, shelter and shelter management, food and non-food items, first aid, social support and restoring family links as well. Last but not least, management of the dead bodies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The extreme flooding followed heavy downpours brought by Storm Daniel to the east of the country. Across the region, towns and villages were inundated. Authorities say entire neighbourhoods were washed away. The Red Crescent has appealed for international assistance and says the devastation is on a similar level to the earthquake in neighboring Morocco.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The extent of the devastation is becoming apparent as remote villages are reached by the outside world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: With many small communities flattened, survivors are either burying their relatives or working to clear debris to recover more bodies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In this mountain village of Imin Ntala, at least 70 people are dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Friday's earthquake, the strongest in Morocco in more than a century, killed more than 2,800 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And survivors are demanding help, and quickly. نحن محقورين، لا نلحق نفسنا، نحن نسكن، يمكننا أن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس، نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس نحن نسكن مع الناس The UN has been assessing the impact of the disaster on some of the most vulnerable, the children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: UNICEF estimates that 100,000 of them have been affected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Like all major earthquakes, aftershocks are likely to continue in the days and weeks ahead, putting children and families at further risk. Morocco's government is under pressure to accept more international aid as rescuers battle with exhaustion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So far, it's accepted help from only four countries, Spain, the UK, Qatar and the United Arab Emirates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But the United States, Tunisia, Turkey, Taiwan and France, a former colonial power of Morocco, are some of the nations which are also offering support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: North Korea's leader has arrived in Russia on the famous armored train used by his family for decades on very rare visits abroad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: According to Washington, the objective of the trip is to close an arms agreement that will allow Russia to have the ammunition it needs for the war in Ukraine and North Korea to have economic aid and military technology.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: The meeting between Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un will take place in the coming days, according to the Kremlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_22
sentences.sentence: Russia needs North Korean ammunition to keep an eye on Ukraine, which receives a constant flow of weapons from the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Kim Jong-un is also seeking to strengthen ties with Beijing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: China assured that the two countries are looking to deepen exchanges and cooperation in various fields.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: More than a quarter of a million Russians have voluntarily joined the armed forces in recent months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Tuesday claiming 1,000 to 1,500 Russians were signing voluntary contracts to join military every day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: How many Russian troops are currently in Ukraine? Ukrainian main intelligence directorate spokesperson Major General Badym Skiubitsky stated that the Russian military has concentrated over 420,000 military personnel in occupied Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: That does not include Rosgvardiya, Russian National Guard and other military units and structures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Thus, this number does not fully reflect Russia's total forces involved in the war in Ukraine. Ukrainian and UK military officials reported on the 11th of September that there could be more coming. The UK Ministry of Defense reported that the Russian military intends to recruit 420,000 contract personnel by the end of 2023. The Institute for the Study of War has previously says that this number likely includes many volunteers who are already fighting in Ukraine and who were forced to sign contracts with the Russian Ministry of Defense by the 1st of July this summer. The UK Defense Ministry says in the run-up to the Russian presidential election scheduled for March 2024, Russian authorities will likely seek to avoid further unpopular mobilizations Serbian police have arrested dozens of people following a shootout between

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: migrants that left one dead and three injured the shooting took place in the Heidekovac forest near the Hungarian border. Officers from the regional police and gendarmerie made a number of arrests and seized several rifles. Two migrants have gunshot wounds while the third has head injuries. All of them were taken to a hospital for treatment and according to Serbian authorities their lives are not in danger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Luis Rubiales will have to appear before a judge next Friday. The judge of the Spanish national court has summoned the former president of the Royal Spanish Football Federation to testify as a defendant. A case has been opened against him for sexual assault after the kiss he gave to the footballer Jenny Hermosa following the World Cup final.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The judge accepted the complaint filed by the prosecutor's office for the non-consensual kiss and for the pressure the player received to justify the episode publicly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: As every year, the President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, will deliver her State of the European Union speech.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: On Wednesday, she will explain what has been done during the last year and also highlight the biggest tasks of the upcoming months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ursula von der Leyen prepares her to-do list for the final year of the mandate of this European Commission, probably packed with policy proposals and geopolitical statements.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Euronews correspondents went on the streets of different EU capitals to see how people feel about the European project, because at the end this is all about citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: We asked people on the streets of Athens, Dublin, Roma, Budapest, Madrid, Berlín y Viena para ver qué piensan que la UE debería enfocarse en el próximo año.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Creo que es muy importante que la UE se enfoque en el cambio climático y en la desinformación o en la combate a la desinformación.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Creo que lo más importante es atender a lo que estamos haciendo mal en el Mediterráneo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Lo que estamos dejando morir, que algún día cuando pase el tiempo la historia nos avergonzará.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: El problema más grande es la economía. ¿Por qué somos una economía desagradable? με τρανίσεις ή φλόγγες. hogy azonban mindenki a következő évben meg kell koncentrálnunk. Ez nem tetszik a munkának.

sentences.sentence: This incident adds to the challenges faced by the 30-year-old since his return to Turin in July 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He has grappled with persistent injury issues, whilst his personal life has seen its share of difficulties, with ongoing investigations into allegations of extortion involving his older brother.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: It's hard to imagine, but the contents of this bag are worth between 3 and 6 million

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: It's a Van Gogh painting that was stolen from a museum in the Netherlands three years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: The man in this picture is Detective Arthur Brand, whom they call the Indiana Jones of the art world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: He managed to recover the piece after he was contacted by a person who had access to it, but who says he had nothing to do with the theft. It took 1300 days, but here it is, and I will hand it over in a few moments to the museum director, and I think he will be happy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The painting dates from the beginning of Van Gogh's career and was stolen from the Singer Museum in the city of Laren in March 2020, in the middle of the pandemic when the museum was closed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Both the perpetrator and the original recipient are now behind bars and the painting has been returned to the museum.
